# Draft:Scott "Scottie" Ward__disambig_2

----
Scott "Scottie" Ward is an American media executive, television producer, actor, and private lending industry leader. He is the CEO of Think Realty, a national real estate investment media and education company. Ward is known for co-creating the Discovery Networks television series Shipwreck Men, appearing in Hitchhiker Chronicles on FX, and for his leadership within the American Association of Private Lenders (AAPL), where he serves on the Education Committee and hosts the AAPL Fund Forum.
Early life and education
Scott Ward was born in Lansing, Michigan, United States.
Details about his early education and academic background have not been publicly disclosed.
Television and media career
Ward began his television career as an actor and producer, appearing in two seasons of the FX reality television series Hitchhiker Chronicles.
He later co-created and produced Shipwreck Men, a reality series produced under Discovery Networks / Discovery Studios, which followed marine salvage crews operating off the coast of Florida.
Business and private lending career
Ward is the CEO of Think Realty, which he acquired in 2025.
Under Ward’s leadership, Think Realty produces national conferences, education programs, and multimedia content serving real estate investors and private lenders across the United States.
Industry leadership and education
Ward serves on the Education Committee for the American Association of Private Lenders (AAPL) and has hosted the association’s Fund Forum series for more than three years.
He has authored seven articles in Private Lender, the official publication of AAPL.
In 2024, Ward received the Community Impact Award from AAPL.
Publications

* Additional articles in Private Lender (2020–2024). *(Citations pending)*
